sub_topic: Predicting the products of inorganic reactions
message_1: Which products will form when sodium chloride (NaCl) is mixed with silver nitrate (AgNO3)? Write a balanced chemical equation for the reaction that occurs and identify the type of reaction.
message_2:
When sodium chloride (NaCl) is mixed with silver nitrate (AgNO3), a double displacement reaction occurs, resulting in the formation of silver chloride (AgCl) and sodium nitrate (NaNO3). The balanced chemical equation for this reaction is:

NaCl (aq) + AgNO3 (aq) â†’ AgCl (s) + NaNO3 (aq)

This is a double displacement (also known as a metathesis) reaction, where the cations and anions of the two reactants switch places to form two new products.
